algorithm_technique: Build an adjacency list representing unit conversions and perform a Breadth-First Search (BFS) starting from unit 0.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate how many units of type 0 are equivalent to one unit of each other type.
problem_summary_technical: Models conversions as a graph, using BFS from unit 0 to compute cumulative conversion factors to all other units modulo 10^9 + 7.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding paths in a directed graph where edge weights are conversion factors.
BFS is suitable for finding the shortest path in terms of conversion steps, and accumulating factors along the way.
Modulo arithmetic is essential to prevent overflow for large conversion factors.
